title: SERVEWARE by LOS OBJETOS DECORATIVOS
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
SERVEWARE by LOS OBJETOS DECORATIVOS

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 6, 2023
  • 1 min read

Barcelona-based designer, Rosa Rubio, founded Los Objetos Decorativos in 2015. Known for their elegant use of materials, whether it's tinted glass, clay, or leather, they really know how to infuse the perfect amount of intrigue into the design of their products. The hues across their collections are what first caught our eye. Particularly the opal glass, which is normally difficult to achieve so chicly, especially in items meant for every-day use.


LOD prides themselves on local and sustainable production, utilizing 3D modelers, printing technicians and artisans in Spain.


Items available for purchase on Los Objetos Decorativos.

title: OFFSET STOOL by PHILIPPE MALOUIN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
OFFSET STOOL by PHILIPPE MALOUIN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Nov 17, 2021
  • 1 min read

The Offset stool from British-Canadian designer, Phillip Maloulin combines sleek and modern design principles with just a hint of quirky. Made from solid oak, and comes in natural or black stain. Add to any room to host a drink, plant or candle, in the offseason when it isn't being used for extra seating.



Available for purchase on Shop Horn. $450

  • FURNITURE

title: ABSTRACT PRINTS by RONAN BOUROULLEC
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
ABSTRACT PRINTS by RONAN BOUROULLEC

  • Colleen Russell
  • Dec 29, 2021
  • 1 min read



Art has the ability to evoke an emotional response. Ronan Bouroullec's work does so in a meditative and fluid way. The play on depth, dimension, and shadow is altogether more impressive due to the fact that this work is created with marker. The specific medium is somewhat secondary to the mesmerizing feeling the work evokes. His prints can be a perfect fit for a home office or placed in an entryway to greet you upon your return home.



Available for purchase online at Finnish Design Shop. $60

Vintage Picks - Series 1

One of our favorite pass times is browsing online for vintage finds. 1st Dibs is always at the top of our list, especially when it comes to our most treasured category - lighting. The collection of lamps showcased below represents our latest curation of discoveries, all of which are priced under $1,000. (click on each image for a direct purchase link on 1st Dibs)


We have an affinity for lamps that embrace a delightful blend of textures and hues. Whether it's the allure of glass, the natural charm of stone, the sleekness of chrome, or the warmth of wood, combining these diverse materials with other intriguing textures never fails to create a captivating aesthetic.


Let's not forget the timeless elegance and character that vintage pieces possess. The gentle aging and distinctive features they acquire over the years create a captivating allure. Owning these items means embracing their enduring charm, as they become treasured elements within your home, adding a touch of nostalgia and fascination.

title: ARCH DRINKS TABLE by GRAIN DESIGN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
ARCH DRINKS TABLE by GRAIN DESIGN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 5, 2023
  • 1 min read


The Arch Drinks Table by Grain Design, with its bold and sculptural presence, adds a delightful touch of intrigue to any space. Its captivating design embraces a playful spirit while maintaining a chic aesthetic. Crafted entirely from sustainably sourced mediterranean cork, the Arch Drinks Table boasts an exquisite 100% solid, natural composition.


Cork, renowned for its exceptional sustainability, lies at the heart of this remarkable piece. Sourced from a family-operated business initially established in 1870 in Portugal, this remarkable material embodies numerous desirable attributes, including hypoallergenic properties, resistance to moisture and fire, as well as excellent sound and heat insulation capabilities.


Founded in 2008 by Chelsea and James Minola, and based in Bainbridge Island, WA, Grain emerges as a design practice passionately committed to fostering social and environmental responsibility. Blending modern manufacturing technologies with time-honored craft techniques, their work embodies a harmonious union of the past and present.


The Arch Drinks Table is available for purchase in two different colors, Dark Brown or Natural, online at Grain.

title: TABLE LAMP by MANU BAÑÓ
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TABLE LAMP by MANU BAÑÓ

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 19, 2024
  • 1 min read


Mexico City-based designer Manu Bañó's table lamp is a masterclass in minimalist design where every element serves a clear purpose. At first glance, the lamp's simple geometric composition in raw metal immediately conveys its material, manufacturing process, and functionality. The intersecting forms are meticulously laser-cut from a single metal plate and assembled by hand without welding for a seamless aesthetic. The cylindrical base houses the LED light source while the circular negative space becomes a pivoting screen to precisely direct the illumination.


Bañó exemplifies his ability to transform humble materials into objects of modern sculpture through meticulous craftsmanship. By reducing the design to its essential components, he creates a piece that needs no explanation - it simply performs its role with quiet brilliance. The elemental table lamp invites users to appreciate the inherent beauty of its industrial form in both lit and unlit states.


Hailing from Valencia, Spain, Manu Bañó's creative upbringing sparked an early interest in materials and craft. After studying industrial design and furniture, he honed his skills through collaborations in London before relocating to Mexico City in 2013. Working from his studio there, Bañó has developed an experimental yet functional aesthetic that blends European and Mexican influences. His boundary-pushing pieces have earned him exhibitions at top design fairs and accolades like the IF Design Award. Through his innate feel for materiality and form, Bañó invites viewers to experience the extraordinary artistic potential in thoughtful design.


Available for purchase at Manu Bañó.

title: TAPER CANDLES by THE FLORAL SOCIETY
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TAPER CANDLES by THE FLORAL SOCIETY

  • Colleen Russell
  • Nov 14, 2021
  • 1 min read


The Floral Society takes something traditional and monastic and makes it contemporary and modern... the taper candle. Their candles are all hand molded and fit within any standard holder you might have laying around. There is a great variety of sophisticated colors for any season and each candle is crafted to burn about an hour an inch, so one taper will long outlast thanksgiving dinner, and all the possible bickering after. They also come in a variety of different styles & sizes. Can be used on a daily basis or brought out for special occasions for a statement making tablescape.



Available for purchase at The Floral Society. $37/pair

title: FLORA FOOTED VASE by STUDIO H COLLECTION
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
FLORA FOOTED VASE by STUDIO H COLLECTION

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 8, 2023
  • 1 min read

Small in size but mighty in impact, we admire the transformative power that even petite objects can possess within a space. The Flora Footed Vase collection, designed by Studio H Collection, offers a wide array of distinct stones. Each vase showcases its own unique beauty, and is available in shades of Onyx, the graceful allure of the Rose marble, and the rustic charm of the Rust Travertine. Whether displayed individually or in combination, these vases are sure to leave a lasting impression on any space they occupy.


Kelly Hinchman, the visionary founder and principal designer of Studio H Collection, possesses a profound passion for creating functional, multi-purpose products that retain a sense of uniqueness and distinction. With a penchant for sculptural aesthetics, she skillfully integrates organic materials and diverse textures, resulting in breathtaking collections that captivate the eye. The full range of creations at Studio H is truly a marvel to behold, showcasing Kelly's unwavering commitment to creating extraordinary and captivating designs.


The Flora Footed Vase is available for purchase online at Studio H Collection.

title: MEND SERIES CERAMICS by DBO HOME
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
MEND SERIES CERAMICS by DBO HOME

  • Colleen Russell
  • Feb 15, 2023
  • 1 min read

Updated: Feb 15, 2023


This limited edition ceramics series from DBO home instantly caught our eye. Appropriately titled "Mend" these pieces breathe fresh life into cracked DBO designs that otherwise would've been destined for the garbage. Revitalizing them in a way that feels unique and special, each item is mended using homemade hammered copper staples.


Available for purchase online at DBO Home while supplies last.

DBO Home was founded by husband and wife team, Dana Brandwein + Daniel Oates. They design and produce a full line of homewares, including dinnerware, serveware, accents, lighting, and custom furniture, that celebrates the tactile and aesthetic pleasures that come from filling your home with things that cultivate a sense of wellbeing. Their handcrafted goods are both made to last and enjoy every day.

title: GLASSWARE by DEPARTO
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
GLASSWARE by DEPARTO

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jul 7, 2022
  • 1 min read

Our glassware obsession continues with the elegant wine glass collection from Departo. We instantly fell in love with the soft gray shade and it's modern yet delicate silhouette.


Also available in a high or low glass option. Comes in Clear or Smoke and sold individually. $18


"The idea for Departo was born out of a partnership between famed design firm Yabu Pushelberg and furniture maker Stellar Works. Tasked to create a collection of folding furniture, the two saw their collaboration as the start of something larger — with potential for every home.


Translating these original innovations into a complete homeware assortment, they established departo in 2019 as a ‘departure’ from out-of-reach luxury goods. Across every category — ceramic, glass, textile, metal and accessories — each product is a testament to their unwavering commitment to quality and radical vision for elevated design without the elevated price. "


Available for purchase at Departo.

title: GLASSWARE by BELA SILVA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
GLASSWARE by BELA SILVA

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 7, 2023
  • 1 min read

The glassware collection by Bela Silva, created for the Belgian design label Serax, is simply enchanting. It boasts a contemporary design that seamlessly blends with its delightful charm. Aptly named Eternal Snow, the collection draws inspiration from the captivating colors of the night sky. Our personal favorite is the beautiful muted grey, which lends a subtle and sophisticated touch. The glasses' unique shape and the bubbles intentionally left visible at the base add a playful, yet elegant vibe. They are perfect for special occasions, yet versatile enough to be used as a striking addition to your everyday kitchenware. You can even mix and match the glasses to create your own one-of-a-kind collection.


Available for purchase at Enter The Loft.

title: CLAY TEAPOTS by JONAS LINDHOLM
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CLAY TEAPOTS by JONAS LINDHOLM

  • Colleen Russell
  • Apr 12, 2024
  • 1 min read


The Red Clay Teapot by Swedish ceramic designer Jonas Lindholm is a striking piece that tea enthusiasts will surely want to add to their collection. Featuring a rich, earthy crimson glaze in an alluring hue that immediately draws the eye. The gentle, flowing curves of the design exude a sense of tranquility and organic elegance.


While the deep red version makes a bold statement, Lindholm also offers the teapot in a softer white clay for those preferring a more subtle look. No matter which colorway speaks to you, the artful shapes and high-quality craftsmanship are evident.


Lindholm's diverse collections showcase his talents across various ceramic techniques from slip casting to throwing on the potter's wheel. In addition to his signature teapots, his studio produces an array of cups, bowls, and decorative vessels. Each piece celebrates the versatility of clay through Lindholm's skilled hands.



Available for purchase online at Mjolk.

title: FLECTO FIREPIT by MUHLY
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
FLECTO FIREPIT by MUHLY

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jan 6, 2024
  • 1 min read


The Flecto Firepit, a striking creation from Muhly Design that redefines the conventional notion of fire pits. Inspired by the timeless allure of 1930s jewelry design, it introduces a playful elegance to your patio or garden. Constructed from polished stainless steel, the Flecto not only mirrors its environment but also reflects the flickering flames within, establishing an intimate connection with the outdoor scenery. Its compact and lightweight design allows for easy portability, seamlessly adapting to the ever-changing dynamics of your outdoor space. The Flecto Firepit is a unique fusion of artistry and functionality, promising to be a standout feature that transforms your outdoor ambiance.


The design studio, Muhly, was founded by Ann Edgerton and Megan Carney and is based in Central Texas and Philadelphia.


The Flecto Firepit is available for purchase online at Muhly.

title: KNOT MIRROR by ROLL & HILL
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
KNOT MIRROR by ROLL & HILL

  • Colleen Russell
  • Sep 19, 2023
  • 1 min read


Our heart leans towards designs that embody both smart functionality and warmth, finding beauty in simplicity and uniqueness. We're drawn to those subtle yet powerful details that tell a story. A wonderful example is the Knot Mirror from Roll & Hill—a true testament to excellence in design. Crafted with care from solid wood and available in a variety of options like Ebonized Oak, Hard Maple, Black Walnut, and White Oak, the mirror's intricate side details not only captivate the eye but also serve a purpose: the mirror is hung from either side.


Roll & Hill is a furniture and lighting company that was founded in Greenpoint, Brooklyn in 2010. Featuring American made design collaborations their collections are all handmade in Grand Rapids, Michigan at their manufacturing facilities.


Their designs draw from a multitude of materials, whether that be brass, bronze, leather, wood, rope, or mouth-blown glass. Frequently drawing inspiration from historical nuances while infusing a modern vitality, their pieces are uniquely crafted to stand the test of time, embodying a lasting significance.


Available for purchase online at Roll & Hill.

title: CERAMICS by PERLA VALTIERRA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CERAMICS by PERLA VALTIERRA

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jul 30, 2022
  • 1 min read


Handmade in Mexico, the collections of Perla Valtierra are a refreshing, romantic addition to your dinnerware. So chic and beautifully hued, their pieces also double as decor. Using techniques inspired by local pottery traditions and made from Bajio earthenware. The delicate scalloped edges and looped folds are perfect examples of true artistry in ceramics.



Available for purchase at Perla Valtierra. (prices vary)

title: RING VASE by SLORENCE
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
RING VASE by SLORENCE

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jul 25, 2022
  • 1 min read

The Ring Vase collection from South Korean artist, Jiuen Kim, is sculptural, functional art at its finest.


This stylish piece is designed to hold one (or in some cases two) stems, fresh or dried. Can also be displayed as a stand alone sculpture. It's meant to highlight and observe the flowers progression from the moment of full bloom until they wither.


Comes in a variety of organic shapes and glazes made from only a few strips of clay.

Available for purchase at The Ode To. Prices vary.

title: CERAMICS by LANA KOVA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CERAMICS by LANA KOVA

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 2, 2023
  • 1 min read


The signature Dots collection created by talented ceramist Lana Kova, is truly captivating and leaves a lasting impression. Each piece is meticulously crafted from slip-cast porcelain, displaying the artist's skill and attention to detail. What sets this collection apart is its distinct charm and elegance, brought to life through the intricate hand-painted dots that adorn each piece. The minimalist design choice allows the beauty of the porcelain to shine through while adding a delightful visual intrigue.


The use of slip-cast porcelain in the creation of each piece further enhances the allure of each collection. This traditional technique involves pouring liquid clay into plaster molds, resulting in a smooth and refined finish. The combination of the slip-casting process and Lana's artistic vision results in flawless ceramic pieces that radiate elegance and craftsmanship.



Lana Kova Studio, based in Tribeca NYC was founded in 2014. Lana was raised in Russia and is a self-taught ceramist, painter, and sculptor who spent years perfecting her craft in Europe.


The Dots Collection is available for purchase online at Lana Kova.

title: PORCELAIN SCENTING BRANCHES by WMS & CO
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
PORCELAIN SCENTING BRANCHES by WMS & CO

  • Colleen Russell
  • Dec 4, 2024
  • 1 min read



Imagine filling your space with the calming scent of palo santo or your favorite essential oil, all while enjoying the understated beauty of handcrafted design. These porcelain scenting branches from Wms & Co are more than just a home fragrance accessory—they’re a sensory experience.


Crafted from fine Limoges porcelain by a centuries-old French company, these branches are both elegant and functional. With just a few drops of essential oil, they transform into a subtle diffuser, gently releasing aroma into the air. Paired with the solid wood base—available in ebonized wood, honey oak, or pale ash—this set is as visually striking as it is aromatically pleasing.


The set includes three delicate porcelain branches, a base, and a 5ml bottle of steam-distilled palo santo oil, known for its grounding and purifying qualities. Even without oil, the branches make a striking decorative accent, their organic form adding a sculptural element to any surface.


Available for purchase at Wms & Co.

title: THE WISH STONES by EUNJIN BAE FOR INK + PORCELAIN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
THE WISH STONES by EUNJIN BAE FOR INK + PORCELAIN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Sep 13, 2023
  • 1 min read

Updated: Sep 19, 2023



Let these one-of-a-kind ceramic holders become your new favorite treasures. Handcrafted by LA designer Eunjin Bae exclusively for Ink and Porcelain, The Wish Stones radiate a soothing aura with their rounded forms and smooth, cool touch.


Inspired by meditative stone stacking in the forests of Korea, each piece offers a space for quiet reflection or displaying your valuables. Make a wish as you add rings, earrings, matches or any petite objects to these modern vessels.


With three sizes available in an exquisite blue-gray glaze, The Wish Stones are perfect for elevating your bedroom, bathroom or living room. Their understated yet striking beauty will bring a sense of ritual and mindfulness wherever they rest.


Available for purchase at Ink and Porcelain in three different sizes, and a glazed exterior that's a lovely shade of grey/ blue.

title: DRIED & PRESERVED FLOWERS by AFLORAL
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
DRIED & PRESERVED FLOWERS by AFLORAL

  • Colleen Russell
  • Dec 8, 2021
  • 1 min read



Like many, I grew up associating dried flowers as something my grandmother would buy and no one would like. That being said, there are always plenty of nooks in a home that just don't get enough natural light for a living plant or flower. In my apartment it was the top of a leaning bookshelf. Afloral came along and completely solved my problem of wanting to fill a darker space with plant life, whilst still looking chic. Afloral offers a vast assortment of dried and preserved flowers and grasses in all different shapes, sizes, and color palettes—to suit your own design aesthetic.



Available for purchase online at Afloral. prices vary





  • DECOR

title: REFLECTING FLAME by CHRISTIAN AND JADE
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
REFLECTING FLAME by CHRISTIAN AND JADE

  • Colleen Russell
  • Oct 5, 2022
  • 1 min read

Christian Hammer Juhl and Jade Chan, a design duo from Copenhagen, know how to effortlessly create the perfect ambience. This limited edition wall mountable candleholder "Reflective Flame" doubles as sculptural art, allowing the materials and design to speak for themselves.


It's a powerful statement on its own and enhanced even further when containing a lit candle, perfectly placed to radiate warmth and dance in its reflection.


Each piece is handcrafted, hammered and finished by hand. Available in either aluminum or brass, with an option for one or two candleholders.


Reflecting Flame I and II are available for purchase at Studio Oliver Gustav.

title: GO SHUN STOOL by YOON SHUN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
GO SHUN STOOL by YOON SHUN

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 16, 2024
  • 1 min read



Combining traditional techniques with contemporary design, the Go Shun Stool by Yoon Shun showcases the artist's mastery of working with wood. Solid oak beams are meticulously carved using the ancient practice of wood burning, resulting in an intricate pattern etched into the surface.


While rooted in tradition, this piece exemplifies modern craftsmanship. To protect the intricate wooden design from wear and tear, seven layers of tung oil are carefully applied, ensuring the natural beauty of the grain is preserved while providing a protective coating.


The attention to detail in both the carving process and the finishing touches highlights the artist's dedication to their craft. This stool is a unique piece that celebrates the enduring appeal of woodworking and the fusion of time-honored methods with contemporary aesthetics.


Yoon Shun's artistic vision transcends boundaries, seamlessly fusing purpose with poetic expression. Through intricate craftsmanship and a meditative approach, his sculptural pieces reveal the invisible narratives that lie beneath surfaces.


Available for purchase online at Objects With Narratives.

title: TOWELS by BAINA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TOWELS by BAINA

  • Colleen Russell
  • Feb 25, 2023
  • 1 min read

Most brands produce bath towels but few demand your attention quite like Baina. Founded by Australian based Bailey Meredith and Anna Fahey, their designs and are the most special we've come across in the towel industry.


The clean and austere shades and patterns lend themselves perfectly for mixing and matching in a room where design often takes the passenger seat.



Available for purchase on Baina.

title: HUG TRAY by KOUROS MAGHSOUDI
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
HUG TRAY by KOUROS MAGHSOUDI

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 25, 2023
  • 1 min read

Kouros Maghsoudi, hailing from Chicago, captivates us with his designs that exude joyful creativity. They effortlessly embody a modern sense of chicness without sacrificing their whimsical allure, making them a refreshing addition to any space. Among these designs is the hand-poured Hug tray, a ceramic piece crafted by using an intricate electroplating technique that creates its truly distinctive finish.


Whether used as an ashtray or a stylish catch-all for keys and trinkets, the Hug tray seamlessly blends sculptural artistry and practicality, making it a versatile and cherished addition to any space.


Available for purchase online at Kouros Maghsoudi.

title: IGNUS FLAMELESS CANDLE by AUDO COPENHAGEN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
IGNUS FLAMELESS CANDLE by AUDO COPENHAGEN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Oct 22, 2023
  • 1 min read


Bring cozy ambiance to any space with the Ignus Flameless Candle from Audo Copenhagen. This innovative candle mimics the natural flicker of a real flame, but without the fire hazard or mess. The LED technology illuminates the structure with a warm glow that sets the perfect mood for relaxation.


With its sleek, modern design, this candle makes a stylish accent for tables, mantels, and shelves. A versatile lighting option, it adds beauty and warmth to both indoor and outdoor spaces. You can choose from multiple sizes to create an inviting vignette. The realistic flicker and ambient light from the candle create a soothing atmosphere for any spot in your home.


Audo Copenhagen epitomizes refined Danish design. Their minimalist aesthetic and innovative details create true works of art. When we seek out pieces that are modern yet enduring, Audo Copenhagen is always top of mind. Their thoughtful approach and timeless style produce designs that transcend trends.


Available for purchase online at Audo Copenhagen.

title: LIGHTING by OLIVIA BOSSY
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
LIGHTING by OLIVIA BOSSY

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jul 16
  • 1 min read

There is a quiet clarity to Olivia Bossy’s work — a sense that each line, surface, and intersection has been weighed with care. The No. 0122 floor lamp and No. 0222 wall sconce are thoughtful expressions of this approach: minimal yet dimensional, sculptural yet understated.


These pieces feel less like lighting and more like spatial compositions. The forms are precise, elemental. Each uses a limited palette of materials to explore contrast — soft linen set against darkened wood, slender verticals anchored by grounded bases. Light is shaped rather than simply emitted.


What draws us in is the restrained design, exuding quiet confidence. These objects provide atmosphere, not just illumination. Timeless and detailed, they are pieces meant to be lived with and revisited.


Olivia Bossy is a designer based in Sydney, working at the intersection of furniture, lighting, and sculpture. Her practice is grounded in a deep respect for material and form, with each piece shaped by an architectural sensibility and a poetic use of scale. She creates work that is quietly expressive — tactile, enduring, and always intentional.


View her full collection online at oliviabossy.com

title: TERRAZZA PLANTER by LSA INTERNATIONAL
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TERRAZZA PLANTER by LSA INTERNATIONAL

  • Colleen Russell
  • Oct 8, 2023
  • 1 min read




The Terrazza Planter from LSA International elevates any space with its eye-catching design available in three versatile heights.


Crafted from a handblown glass bowl perched atop a sleek powder-coated steel column, this planter combines artful style with thoughtful functionality. The transparent glass center gracefully spotlights greenery while allowing ambient light to filter through for the plant's health. Whether grouped together for impact or standing solo as a statement piece, the Terrazza Planter lends an elevated touch of contemporary flair.


Blending skilled artisanship with modern design, LSA International creates distinctive handblown glass pieces from their London studio. Their passion is crafting thoughtful, purposeful objects that bring value to daily living through their combination of quality materials and contemporary forms. With an emphasis on the integrity of traditional techniques, LSA International aims to produce glassware and accessories that feel both timeless and current. Their goal is to elevate spaces with imaginative designs that merge creative vision with meticulous workmanship.


The Terrazza Planter is available for purchase online at LSA International.

title: CERAMIC ROPE ARCHES by CINDY HSU ZELL
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CERAMIC ROPE ARCHES by CINDY HSU ZELL

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 8, 2024
  • 1 min read

Cindy Hsu Zell's artwork is a captivating exploration of simplicity and grace. The LA-based designer has carved a unique niche by combining ceramics with hand spun rope, resulting in creations that beautifully capture the delicate essence of motion, and sophistication.


With an understated elegance, Zell's pieces effortlessly complement any space, infusing it with an air of tranquility and artistic depth that captivates the observer. The meticulous blend of textures and a carefully curated palette imbue her works with a subtle yet profound beauty, creating a sense of timelessness that quietly transforms environments into havens of refined elegance.


The resulting artworks not only adorn spaces but also engage the senses, creating an enduring appeal that transcends fleeting trends. Zell's aesthetic delicacy resonates with observers, inviting them to experience the serene beauty that emerges from the harmonious interplay of materials and forms.


Offered in an array of shapes and sizes, each piece captivates with its distinct allure, inviting one to mix and curate multiples for a visually striking artistic statement.


Available for purchase online at Cindy Hsu Zell.

title: TRAYS by ANASTASIO HOME
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TRAYS by ANASTASIO HOME

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 22, 2022
  • 1 min read

We love how playful and chic are perfectly married in these hand-made trays from Anastasio Home.


Each and every one of their designs and palettes are spot on and would be perfect for showcasing special treasures or everyday trinkets, in any part of your home. Comes in either marble or travertine stone, in varying shapes, sizes and colors, and are hand-sculpted in Rajasthan, India.


Anastasio Home is a producer of limited-run home accessories and up-cycled luxury goods based in Litchfield County, Connecticut, and was founded by Gabriela Anastasio Holloway in 2021.

Available for purchase / preorder from Anastasio Home. Prices vary.

title: A CONVERSATION WITH: Mon Pilar
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
A CONVERSATION WITH: Mon Pilar

  • Colleen Russell
  • Feb 7, 2023
  • 1 min read


Mon Pilar is a Brooklyn-based fine jewelry brand founded by Brigid McNellis. Her designs are inspired by ancient techniques and executed with a modern twist, suitable (and special enough) for everyday wear. We sat down with Brigid in her studio to learn a bit more about her process and creative motivations.


Shop Online monpilar.com |@mon_pilar_jewelry

title: LIGHTING by TAIWAN LANTERN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
LIGHTING by TAIWAN LANTERN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 17, 2023
  • 1 min read

Updated: Mar 17, 2023



We never would have thought a hanging lantern could be a treasured heirloom fixture until coming across Taiwan Lantern. The amount of care, craftsmanship, and attention to detail that go into the design and production of each light is truly magnetizing.


Coming from a rich history of lantern making in Taiwan, and made in a factory that's been producing handmade lanterns since 1951. Each lantern is dyed using locally grown plants and wild roots from nearby mountains. Dozens of processes go into the production of each light and multiple artisans contribute throughout the process.


"Our rich traditions and well-preserved Chinese culture is over a thousand years old. Lanterns have a storied past dating back centuries and can still be seen in daily life throughout our beautiful island. In Taiwan, lanterns are a symbol of hope, joy and celebration."

- Taiwan Lantern


Available for purchase online at Taiwan Lantern.

title: PEWTER COLLECTION by SALTER HOUSE
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
PEWTER COLLECTION by SALTER HOUSE

  • Colleen Russell
  • Dec 5, 2024
  • 1 min read

With locations in both Brooklyn and Manhattan, Salter House has long been one of our favorite spots for discovering beautiful, thoughtfully curated goods. This beloved boutique offers an array of treasures that perfectly balance beauty and functionality.


Their pewter housewares are no exception—ideal for gifting or enhancing your own daily rituals. From elegant candle holders with matching snuffers to stunning teapots and serveware, each piece brings a touch of old-world charm to modern living.


The distinctive pewter collection is the result of a collaboration with a family-run American foundry, one of the last of its kind. Crafted using antique molds and traditional techniques, each piece is hand-forged with an emphasis on quality and craftsmanship, making them true heirlooms to treasure.


Available for purchase at Salter House.

title: 'WIGGLE' FURNITURE COLLECTION by WORN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
'WIGGLE' FURNITURE COLLECTION by WORN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 14, 2023
  • 1 min read

Updated: Mar 17, 2023


We recently came across Australian-based lifestyle company, Worn, and instantly fell in love with their sustainable and incredibly chic designs. Founded in 2015 by Lia-Belle King and Lotte Barnes, the two gain inspiration from time spent living in Indonesia. The company is founded on the idea that great design doesn't have to be compromised when it comes to sustainability and accessibility.


One of our favorites is the 'Wiggle' handwoven furniture collection. Incredibly versatile in design and function and will make any space at home all the more special by its presence.


"Every furniture product is made using timber from reforesting plantations, zero chemicals and toxic finishes, and for every furniture product sold a tree is planted in its place on Indonesian soil, and a native tree planted on Australian soil. The Worn ready-to-wear collection utilises only organic and natural fabrications and all makers of our clothing are self employed contractors living in Australia and Indonesia. The empowerment Worn provides through their production partnerships is authentic, rare, and sets a precedent.

Care, responsibility and quality are the three key concepts at the heart of Worn Store, along with the goal to educate consumers that it is possible to design beautiful pieces for the home, and to wear, that are both environmentally aware and sustainably made. " - Worn


Available for purchase online at Worn.

title: NAIL POLISH by J.HANNAH
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
NAIL POLISH by J.HANNAH

  • Colleen Russell
  • Feb 7, 2022
  • 1 min read


We're always sure to stock-up on these non toxic, high-quality nail polishes from J.Hannah. Founder of the company, Los Angelos based designer Jess Hannah, really knows how to craft a unique palette. From Ghost Ranch to Compost, each color is thoughtfully curated to fit the non-traditional customer. Also available in mini-sets for the indecisive! (trust us, it'll be difficult to pick just one)


And it's important to note, the company currently donates 100% of the profits from the Dune polish to a rotating roster of human rights organizations.


Discover the full collection at J.Hannah. prices vary

title: FIREFLY CANDLEHOLDER by ICHENDORF MILANO
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
FIREFLY CANDLEHOLDER by ICHENDORF MILANO

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jan 2, 2022
  • 1 min read



Ichendorf Milano's 'Firefly' collection of candleholders, are delicate in all the right ways. Each curve feels intentional and guides your eye throughout the piece. They are a cost effective way to class up any coffee, end or entryway table. According to the designer "Naoko Shintani, they are "Cut from borosilicate glass, the silhouette of the circular candleholder takes inspiration from the shape of a firefly — an influence that plays out nicely when the candleholder is arranged amongst other pieces from the same collection."



Available for purchase in clear, amber, and smoke at Pon The Store. $13 - $17

title: WALLPAPER by TIGRON & FLOYD
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
WALLPAPER by TIGRON & FLOYD

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 22, 2022
  • 1 min read


Looking for a bold addition to any room? Tigron and Floyd immediately caught our attention with their unique interpretations of floral and greenery patterns for wallpaper.


This Swedish company is known not only for their inventive designs, but also their dedication to sustainability. Each wallpaper is printed on environmentally certified non-woven materials with colors that are water-based and completely free from solvents and PVC.


And if wallpaper isn't your thing, we suggest buying a sheet for framing of a size that's to your liking.


For a little more on the artistry of their process here's a quote from the designers themselves,


"Everything you see in our patterns are real life objects we found/saw/harvested while looking for inspiration. The ginkgo leaves, for example, come from the trees at Hornsgatan in Stockholm. We took them to our studio, shot them and digitally cut every single leaf out from the background - from all the ginkgo-files we created a pattern. That’s why our wallpapers are so detailed and realistic. Simply because they are real!"


Available for purchase at Tigron Floyd. prices vary.

title: PORCELAIN POSY COLLECTION by CONNECTED GOODS
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
PORCELAIN POSY COLLECTION by CONNECTED GOODS

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 30, 2023
  • 1 min read

Connected Goods, a Montana-based company established in 2009, has captured our hearts with their delightful scalloped dish collection. While black may not typically be associated with dinnerware, these designs exude a sense of sophistication and captivate the eye. Mixing and matching them with other pieces from the collection enhances their charm. Hand-painted on porcelain, each piece in this collection possesses a unique allure. Not only do they serve as exquisite dinnerware, but they also double as versatile catch-alls for treasured trinkets and special items in your everyday life.


By carefully curating their collections, Connected Goods merges the rich heritage of Fair Trade items with locally sourced, American Made products. Each one of their products is meticulously crafted by skilled artisans worldwide, using time-honored techniques inherited across generations. They proudly source from artisans in developing regions, ensuring fair wages, community development, and environmental sustainability. Additionally, they support local emerging independent artists who share their commitment to Fair Trade values.


The Posy Collection is available for purchase online at Connected Goods.

title: TYLO RING by SHW JEWELRY
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TYLO RING by SHW JEWELRY

  • Colleen Russell
  • Aug 23, 2022
  • 1 min read


Stillhouse Jewelry is one of our all time beloved jewelry boutiques in NYC. Each piece from SHW is carefully and thoughtfully crafted using sustainably sourced materials and recycled or reclaimed metals and gemstones.


The Tylo Ring from their newest collection is an instant classic, its structural band perfectly married to the star of the show, the Ruby. Available in 14k yellow, white, or rose gold set with 0.16ct ruby


All SHW Jewelry is designed and made in New York City, but can also be purchased online at SHW.

title: WOODY HOOK by COOEE DESIGN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
WOODY HOOK by COOEE DESIGN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Aug 30, 2023
  • 1 min read

We hold a strong belief in imbuing each corner of our home with a distinctive character. Even the most ordinary objects—like a coat rack—possess the ability to significantly transform an entryway. Being among the first items to catch your eye upon entering, it plays a key role in establishing the overall ambiance of a space.


The Woody Coat Hook from Cooee Design is such a charming, unique approach to an everyday functional item.

Designed by Eddie Gustafsson and made from solid high quality oak and available in two different options, natural or stained black. Eddie, a Swedish designer, is celebrated for his remarkable fusion of aesthetics and practicality, a skill that distinctly sets his pieces apart.


Established in 2008, Cooee Design stands out with its minimalistic designs, organic color palette, and a wide selection crafted for elegant homes. It proudly offers a varied collection of premium interior products to customers worldwide.

Available for purchase online at Cooee Design.

title: THRESHOLD LIGHT by ALEXIS & GINGER
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
THRESHOLD LIGHT by ALEXIS & GINGER

  • Colleen Russell
  • Aug 26, 2023
  • 1 min read


The designs by Alexis & Ginger embody a blend of romance, artistic ingenuity, and modern charm. Notably, their sconce collection shines as a beloved highlight within their offerings. Crafted from solid wood, these pieces bring a unique touch to any space they grace. Their adaptability is also a key feature, serving as both a practical table lamp and a tasteful wall sconce.


Founded by Ginger Gordon and Alexis Tingey in 2023, their NYC-based practice delves into profound material exploration, yielding pieces infused with historical narratives through abstract compositions. Each work is a beloved heirloom, a homage to architectural structures and a celebration of exceptional design.


Inquire online at Alexis & Ginger to purchase.

title: DISC ORB SURFACE MOUNT by IN COMMON WITH

DISC ORB SURFACE MOUNT by IN COMMON WITH

Simplicity, when executed well, can sometimes justify the cost. In Common With's "Disc Orb Surface Mount" is the height of minimalism and refinement. Their mounting hardware is completely concealed by the bulb, which adds a degree of sophistication to any wall. (though they offer an option to purchase a plug-in version)


This light can also be hung in almost any space. The general pallet of ICW's work is subdued, which allows for the their work to exist, as if it's been there all along.

Comes in a few different colors, (though our personal favorite is Pistachio), and available for purchase on

In Common With $1,300

title: CERAMICS by SOLENNE BELLOIR
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CERAMICS by SOLENNE BELLOIR

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 13, 2023
  • 1 min read


We deeply admire the charming and assured nature of Solenne Belloir's designs. There is a genuine appreciation for how a vase can truly impact a space. Her creative vision and confidence challenge traditional perceptions of vases. They can stand as art on their own or be elevated by the choice of flowers they hold. The boldness of these vessels and their use of negative space is truly remarkable. Belloir's designs have a hint of brutalist influence that are beautifully contrasted when adorned with delicate flowers.


Parisian ceramic artist, Solenne Belloir takes inspiration from urban architecture, particularly pipes and chimneys, and the organic beauty of climbing vines and branches. Solenne seamlessly blends industrial elements with natural motifs.


Exlpore the full collection online at Solenne Belloir.

title: CALM LIGHT by TWODO

CALM LIGHT by TWODO

Japanese lighting brand, Twodo was brought to life by engineers Masahiko Shindo and Kozo Ando. Their star design, The Calm Light is perfect for any space in need of a little extra warmth and ambiance. Made from oil finished Natural wood in three different stains. Even better it works off two AA batteries, so you can install it almost anywhere.


Available for purchase at Rikumo $82

HELEN CANDELABRA by SUMMER SCHOOL

Visit Summer School for delightfully playful home decor accessories, handmade by Karen D'Ambrosi in Richmond, Virginia. The Helen Candelabra is a personal favorite. It pairs perfectly with a colored taper, though a monotone shade would be equally as compelling.

title: CANDLE VESSELS by MORO DABRON
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CANDLE VESSELS by MORO DABRON

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 23, 2023
  • 1 min read


English brand, Moro Dabron, offers a stoneware candle collection that's an instant classic, combining rustic, vintage-inspired designs with a modern touch. These candles add a delightful ambiance to any space they adorn. Suitable for indoor or outdoor use, they make for perfect gifts as the vessels are reusable.


The collection offers four different versions: "The Herbarium Candle," made from terracotta, featuring a warm, woody, and herbaceous fragrance; "The Augustine Candle," a black stoneware with top notes of frankincense and captivating hints of agarwood, vetiver, amber, and musk; "The Cyrus Candle," a gorgeous beige color capturing the essence of fresh rain with hinoki, patchouli, and earthy scents; and finally, "The Of Gardens Candle," a soft, crisp white color featuring notes of citrus and florals.


Moro Dabron, a collaboration between Austin Moro and Eliza Dabron, combines their passion for romantic interiors, gardens, fragrance, and aesthetics. Since 2020, they have created a collection of Eau de Parfums and fragranced candles that are warm, inviting, and feature musky undertones and hints of nature. Their creations embody the allure of meticulous craftsmanship, evoking images of serene galleries, vibrant gardens, and scent as a profound and reflective journey.



Available for purchase online at Moro Dabron.

title: U CANDLE by GLAZE STUDIO
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
U CANDLE by GLAZE STUDIO

  • Colleen Russell
  • Feb 14, 2022
  • 1 min read



Glaze Studio effortlessly excels when it comes to the reinventing of a new type of taper. Their U Candle is flawless in its design and execution. Made from 100% beeswax and secured by a solid brass holder at its center point.


Husband and wife team behind Glaze Studio, Akeem and Stephanie Glaze, founded their company in 2017. All candles are hand poured and designed in-house at their studio in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.


Available for purchase at Glaze Studio. The U Candle comes in two different color ways, Ivory or Black. ($125 for the candle w/brass holder and $75 for candle refill)

title: HARMONIA NECKLACE by MAGGOOSH
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
HARMONIA NECKLACE by MAGGOOSH

  • Colleen Russell
  • Apr 27, 2022
  • 1 min read

Updated: May 10, 2022


Understated yet impactful, the Harmonia Necklace from Maggoosh is truly something to be marveled. It's interlocking chains make for a fresh new take on the standard necklace, and lay beautifully across the neck.


Comes in either 14 Karat Gold or 18K Gold plated Silver for a more affordable option. Also available in a two-tone, one silver chain interlocking with a gold chain.


Margarita Chrissaki started Maggoosh at the impressive age of 19. Her designs are inspired by movement and fluidity, creating pieces that fit uniquely into every day life. All pieces are handmade through craftsmen located in Margarita's hometown, Athens, Greece.


Available for purchase at Maggoosh.

title: BACCHUS BOOKENDS by VIRGINIA SIN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
BACCHUS BOOKENDS by VIRGINIA SIN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Oct 17, 2023
  • 1 min read

The Bacchus Bookends are a subtle yet impactful decorative accent. Crafted from clay, they feature smooth, rounded edges that contrast with the sharp lines of books and shelves. The minimalist shapes allow the beauty of the clay and sculptural form to take center stage. A muted color palette and matte glaze provide an earthy, neutral look. Their organic aesthetic enhances any space with quiet style.


Based in Brooklyn, Virginia Sin is a designer driven by artistic exploration. She strives to broaden her creative boundaries beyond the conventional. Sin is recognized for elevating clay in both decor and lighting, transforming the earthy medium into lamps and fixtures that emit a soft, welcoming glow.


Sin's passion for design shines through in pieces that reveal both her talent and commitment to innovation. Unconfined by labels, she develops her signature multi-disciplinary style with each new endeavor. Virginia Sin continues to push herself as an artist, letting curiosity guide her path and inspiring others to expand their creative horizons along the way.


The Bacchus Bookends are available for purchase online at Virginia Sin.

title: GLASS LANTERN by MUN DELUXE VENEZIA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
GLASS LANTERN by MUN DELUXE VENEZIA

  • Colleen Russell
  • Sep 24, 2023
  • 1 min read


Illuminate your space with the radiant romance of the Mun Deluxe Venezia glass lantern. This exquisite candle holder, handcrafted from mouth-blown Murano glass, emanates a soft, alluring glow that brings warmth and intrigue to any corner. Place it upon your table to set the mood for an intimate dinner party, or allow it to cast a delicate light upon a bedside table. However you choose to display this heirloom-quality accent piece, its refined beauty will gracefully enhance your decor. It comes in two different sizes and an array of different shades.


Through their glassware, the Italian heritage brand Mun Deluxe Venezia pays homage to generations of master artisans. Each collection celebrates the unique splendor and versatility of the medium. Drawing inspiration from Venetian aesthetics, time-honored methods, and classical forms, Mun Deluxe Venezia fuses convention with innovation. Both contemporary and classic, the glassware embodies Italian style at its finest - elevated works of functional art to treasure through the decades.


Available for purchase at one of our favorite retailers, Abask.

title: MASKOR TABLE LAMP by MUKA DESIGN LAB

MASKOR TABLE LAMP by MUKA DESIGN LAB

The attention to detail is impressive, with most of the lights also featuring a built in dimmer switch (always a plus in my book). This particular light was created by Muka Design Lab, (an award winning design studio from the Basque region of Spain). It comes in five gorgeous shades and is made using sustainable materials.

title: END TABLE by BESTCASE

content:
END TABLE by BESTCASE

Exuding sophistication and timeless elegance, this end table from Bestcase is a design exemplar. Expertly crafted from premium aluminum, the table's sculptural form strikes a perfect balance between playful and refined. Its pleasing geometry brings a modern sensibility, while the durable materiality ensures enduring quality—a fusion that epitomizes Bestcase's ethos.


Built by skilled artisans, this end table promises to impart subtle grandeur to its setting for generations to come.

Bestcase can also customize any of their furnishings to perfectly accentuate your interior vision. Their designers excel in materializing bespoke decor to elevate any space.


Their manufacturing facility utilizes technologies such as large format industrial laser cutting, CNC press-brakes, and 3D printing, enabling them to produce furnishings of uncompromising quality crafted to stand the test of time. For discerning homeowners seeking impeccable craftsmanship, Bestcase rises to meet every expectation.

title: ETTA NAPKIN RINGS by SOCIETY LIMONTA
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
ETTA NAPKIN RINGS by SOCIETY LIMONTA

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jul 10, 2023
  • 1 min read


Taking inspiration from a weaving shuttle—a tool that carries the thread of the yarn during weaving—the Etta Napkin Rings truly make a lasting impression on a tablescape, transforming an often overlooked element of a table setting into something unforgettable.


Each napkin ring is expertly handcrafted, showcasing the skillful artistry and craftsmanship of the makers. Available in either oak or walnut wood, they exude a luxurious and refined aesthetic, adding an extra layer of elegance and thoughtfulness to your dining experience.


Society Limonta stands out as a trailblazer, embodying not just the label of 'Made in Italy,' but proudly representing 'Made in Limonta.' Originating from Costa Masnaga, near Lecco—a thriving hub in the heart of Italy's textile realm—The Limonta Group was born in 1893. Boasting a rich heritage spanning over a century, this remarkable company has earned its rightful place among the elite ranks of Italy's most esteemed textile enterprises.


Available for purchase online at Society Limonata.

title: CHAINMAIL SCONCE by LIYANG ZHANG STUDIO
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CHAINMAIL SCONCE by LIYANG ZHANG STUDIO

  • Colleen Russell
  • Apr 7, 2024
  • 1 min read


Brooklyn-based artist Liyang Zhang's works have thoroughly captivated our attention. Her collections demonstrate a distinctive inventiveness and originality that feels truly special. It's her lighting collection, however, that particularly caught our eye.


The Chainmail Sconce stands out with its strong yet delicate draped detailing, accented by Chinese frog clasps that add a perfect finishing touch. The chainmail fabric exudes a delicate, gossamer-like quality, belying the strength and durability inherent to the material.


What draws us to Zhang's body of work is the variety of materials and techniques she employs across her collections. Her artistic versatility and exploratory approach make each piece feel unique and carefully crafted.

Her works merge skillful execution with conceptual depth, pushing artistic boundaries while maintaining a cohesive, recognizable style.


For her full collection and purchase details visit Liyang Zhang.

title: VASES by HEIN STUDIO

VASES by HEIN STUDIO

Established in 2016 by the creative duo Rebecca and Brian Hein, Hein Studio specializes in crafting collections of enduring quality. Their shared passion for architecture and the seamless integration of art within living spaces infuses the Heins' creations with timeless craftsmanship and distinct style.


Hein Studio's assortment of glass vases stands out for its exceptional uniqueness. The Ostrea Vases, inspired by the organic ebb and flow of the ocean, exude a captivating sense of movement. Another personal favorite is the Reflection Vase, drawing from the serene lakes of Switzerland, boasting an elegant silhouette reminiscent of classic French florist vessels. These pieces expertly blend the tranquility of nature with practical floral arrangement features, making them exquisite and exclusive centerpieces.


Regardless of whether adorned with flowers or standing alone, these vases effortlessly capture attention. Their graceful forms bring a sense of visual grandeur to any space they inhabit.


Available for purchase online at Hein Studio.

OIL BURNER by TSU LANGE YOR

  • Apr 21, 2024

An exquisite fusion of playfulness and sophistication, the oil burner by Australian company TSU LANGE YOR, in collaboration with Joel Adler, captivates with its delicate balance. Crafted from sleek, hand-cast recycled aluminum, its curves embrace a designated niche carved to house a flickering tealight, casting enchanting shadows upon the tooth silhouette that adorns the piece.


Designed, manufactured, and cast in Australia, this masterpiece transcends mere functionality, becoming a coveted objet d'art – the perfect indulgence for oneself or a unique gift for a loved one. Embodying both whimsy and refinement, it promises to infuse any space with a touch of elegance and enchantment.


Available for purchase online at TSU LANGE YOR.

title: HOLOCENE CANDLE HOLDER by INGEGERD RAMAN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
HOLOCENE CANDLE HOLDER by INGEGERD RAMAN

We are enamored by the remarkable ingenuity and adaptability of this exquisite glass candleholder crafted by the talented Swedish designer, Ingegerd Råman.


Throughout her illustrious career, Ingegerd has honed her artistry in crafting sleek and impactful vases, and this particular creation stands out as a testament to her mastery. What makes this piece truly exceptional is its dual functionality—it serves as an elegant standalone vase, and with the reversible glass insert, it effortlessly transforms into a captivating candleholder.


Notably, the polished steel base adds a touch of sophistication while showcasing the brilliant use of materials. This feature ensures that the candleholder is equally stunning even when used independently, making it a truly versatile and timeless addition to any space.


Available for purchase online from one of our go-to spots for interiors, Canadian brand, Mjolk.

BOE SMALL CANDLEHOLDER by RE JIN LEE

Raised in Sao Paolo, Brazil, Korean design Re Jin Lee uses cultural fusion to distinguish herself amongst her peers. Pulling from eastern and and western design philosophies, her ceramic work is nothing short of inspiring. There is a certain ease, fluidity, and cohesion to Re Jin Lee's work. Once a piece like the Boe Small Candleholder sits on a counter in your home, its understated complexity and motion will effortlessly set itself apart from other items in a room. This is the kind of piece I like to have on its own on an entryway table or group together with a few of her other pieces—for a larger statement.

title: STONEWARE BOWLS by CHAARGOUSH

STONEWARE BOWLS by CHAARGOUSH

We are captivated by the originality of Chaargoush's designs. Behnaz Sharifian, the Seattle-based designer, meticulously crafts each piece with the tactile grace of clay and the artistry of hand-building. Drawing inspiration from the natural seams and creases inherent in slab work, she skillfully incorporates these imperfections as integral elements of her craft.


In her collection of vessels, functionality seamlessly converges with artistry, resulting in pieces that effortlessly blend practicality and contemplation. Sharifian's artistic journey extends beyond the medium of clay; it's a nuanced exploration of the interplay between craftsmanship and the inherent beauty found in life's irregularities. Amidst the artistic whimsy, she maintains a timeless and minimal aesthetic—a delicate equilibrium that defines her artistic voice.


Available for purchase online at Chaargoush.

title: CANDLE STANDS by KANAME TAKEGUCHI
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
CANDLE STANDS by KANAME TAKEGUCHI

  • Colleen Russell
  • Apr 5, 2023
  • 1 min read

When it comes to good interior design, the details matter. Even something as seemingly small and simple as a candle stand can have a significant impact on the overall ambiance and vibe of your home. Investing in well-crafted, aesthetically pleasing accessories can elevate your space to the next level and bring your vision to life.


Kaname Takeguchi, a skilled Japanese artist, has crafted these candle stands that embody delicate simplicity, displaying a refined and exquisite form at its finest. Takaguchi's remarkable craftsmanship shines through each of these pieces, evoking a sense of serenity and gracefulness that is sure to captivate any onlooker.


Drawing inspiration from the allure of antique decor, this modern piece is thoughtfully designed to pay homage to timeless aesthetics while still offering a contemporary feel. The fusion of traditional and modern influences creates a harmonious balance, making these candle stands a true testament to the artist's exceptional talent and vision.


Comes in two different shades, Ivory and Rustic Gold, and two varying heights.


Available for purchase at Kurashi Japanese Crafts.

title: HURRICANE LANTERNS by DEBORADH EHRLICH
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
HURRICANE LANTERNS by DEBORADH EHRLICH

  • Mar 12, 2024
  • 1 min read

For over two decades, celebrated designer Deborah Ehrlich has been creating exquisite crystal glassware pieces. Based in her Hudson Valley studio, Ehrlich meticulously sketches the contemporary forms that are then brought to life by master craftsmen in Sweden using traditional glassblowing, cutting, and polishing techniques.


Her "Hurricane Lanterns" exemplify this harmonious blend of modern aesthetics and time-honored artisanship.

These sophisticated candles reimagine the classic hurricane design with Ehrlich's signature minimalist elegance. Crafted with the utmost precision, each set comprises three hand-blown glass cylinders of varying heights that nestle seamlessly within one another. The slender, cylindrical glass pieces encase a paraffin wax holder available in eight eye-catching metal finishes and two glass versions with contrasting thickness levels. As the flame dances across the looping surfaces of the delicate glass cylinders, it casts a mesmerizing display of kaleidoscopic reflections. Ehrlich's creations are a testament to her ability to unite contemporary forms with the impeccable quality of centuries-old glassmaking traditions.


Available for purchase in small, medium or large online at ER Butler & Co.

title: VINTAGE CANDLE HOLDER by STOFF NAGEL
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
VINTAGE CANDLE HOLDER by STOFF NAGEL

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 19, 2023
  • 1 min read

We are captivated by decor items that embody a sense of playfulness and possess the adaptability to complement various moods and environments. The Stoff Nagel candle holder completely fits that bill and has deservedly served as an inspiration for decor designers and remained a design staple for decades. The iconic form coupled with its extraordinary capacity to metamorphose and stack into different configurations, or interlock with other Stoff Nagel candle holders for a more magnificent effect, showcases the true wonders of its design. We were fortunate to obtain one with a captivating brutalist texture, adding an extra layer of intrigue to an already stunning and imaginative piece.


The story behind the STOFF Nagel brand and its iconic candle holder is truly remarkable. The Nagel family, affected by the aftermath of World War II, began creating art from war remnants to rebuild their livelihood. Hans Nagel, inspired by his father's work, met artist Werner Stoff, and together they conceived the idea of a sculptured candle holder with three finger-like holes. The candle holder represented a departure from the status quo and became a symbol of art and individual expression. It was launched successfully in the late 1960s, bringing fame to the Nagel family. Recently, Danish design company 'STOFF Copenhagen' has revived the iconic piece, reintroducing it to homes worldwide while honoring the original design.



Visit Stoff Nagel for more of their iconic collections.

title: STICK STUD by KATHLEEN WHITAKER
author: Russell Nicolau
content:

title: BIRD SILO by STUDIO TOLVANEN
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
BIRD SILO by STUDIO TOLVANEN

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jun 17, 2022
  • 1 min read


We love this playful, yet functional design of a modern bird feeder. The Bird Silo is made from 100% recycled plastic and rope, and specifically designed to feed birds who like to cling vertically while eating. (including Chickadees, Titmice, Nuthatches, Finches, & Woodpeckers.)


Helsinki-based team, Mika & Julia Tolvanen, designed the product for Pidät after studying the feeding habits of birds outside their home. Founded in 2015, Studio Tolvanen Projects range from small everyday objects to furniture collections, which they design from their studio and workshop on the island of Lauttasaari in Helsinki, Finland.





“We wanted to design a functional sculpture. We also thought Bird Silo should be a bird feeder whose impact on nature is just feeding the birds.”

—Studio Tolvanen



Comes in three different colors, Camp Green, Terracotta, and Slate. Available for purchase at Finnish Design Shop.

title: BRASS OIL BURNER by STUDIO HENRY WILSON
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
BRASS OIL BURNER by STUDIO HENRY WILSON

  • Colleen Russell
  • Mar 25, 2023
  • 1 min read



Exclusively crafted from solid brass by Studio Henry Wilson for Aesop, this exquisite burner is a harmonious blend of exceptional craftsmanship and elegant design, providing a sophisticated and distinctive alternative to traditional burners.


An accomplished Australian designer, Henry specializes in materials such as metal, stone, and leather. Having resided and worked in Sydney for over three decades, it is his go-to place where he feels most uninhibited creatively.


Henry's design philosophy is characterized by an emphasis on utilitarianism, where he strives to imbue clear form and function into all his creations. However, he also places great importance on the emotional connection that his designs evoke. He is drawn to the raw beauty that arises from handcrafted objects and aims to create pieces that are both unique and charming, while remaining sturdy enough to withstand mass manufacture. To this end, he has nurtured long-term collaborations with handpicked suppliers and manufacturers who share his approach, including a local foundry that produces bronze and aluminum cast elements and European stone workers who specialize in artisanal craftsmanship.



Available for purchase online at Studio Henry Wilson.

This zoomorphic shape of a bird is hand-thrown on the wheel by potter Eric Bonnin. Eric crafted 3 versions of this whimsical stoneware pitcher in Small, Medium, and Large. Adopt a “flock” and arrange their “beaks” at different levels.


ABOUT ERIC BONNIN

Inspired by the French Decorative Arts movement and the artists and craftsmen working in Vallauris, France during the post-war period, Eric Bonnin has been working in clay since he moved to New York City from Paris in 1994. Eric’s ceramics combine functionality with simple decorative elements and motifs. Each item is signed with the maker’s mark and the city of origin.


available for purchase at Bloomist. prices ranging from $38 - $98

title: A CONVERSATION WITH: Jewelry Designer Brigid McNellis
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
A CONVERSATION WITH: Jewelry Designer Brigid McNellis

  • Colleen Russell
  • Jan 29, 2022
  • 6 min read


Brigid McNellis is an artist, jewelry designer, and owner of Mon Pilar—a brand focused on creating modern, timeless jewelry, with an emphasis on ancient craft techniques, local production, and responsibly sourced materials.


At the core of the brand lies a fascination and appreciation for craft heritage and ancient cultures. Brigid researches and experiments with centuries-old techniques before designing and crafting the brands own unique pieces. Throughout the collections you will discover the brands signature interpretations of granulation, filigree, and hand crafted chain, as well as references to ancient and iconic symbols. I sat down with Brigid to delve deeper into her upbringing, craft, and inspirations.



Can you tell us a bit about your upbringing, and whether or not that’s been an influence in your particular esthetic choices? I would say my upbringing has been pretty diverse. I was born in Chile, and lived there until I was 7, before my family moved back to the US. Being from two very different cultures has opened me up to a wider perspective of life and generated an intrigue in learning about them. This directly affects my work as I am constantly investigating techniques and styles of jewelry pertaining to civilizations which are quite foreign to me.


I've also always felt like a bit of a hybrid—I've never been able to fully identify with American culture or Chilean culture. I can see this duality in my work as well. My love for ancient and traditional craft as well as for contemporary jewelry, seem to be contradictions that I bring to life through my designs, and maybe it's what gives me a signature style.

How do you conceptualize a new collection and what’s your creative process?

My creative process usually begins with an idea, this can be anything from being inspired by a certain culture, a technique, or a type of jewelry. I then work mostly intuitively and experimentally. Having said that, I always learn a technique well before attempting to use it. But after that I allow my idea to be loose enough to change once I start working at my bench. I have found that the best improvisations happen this way and the piece sort of creates itself. It is also a bit more time consuming and can be less efficient, but It adds an element of surprise and satisfaction that keeps my creativity alive.



The Pompeii necklace was inspired by the exhibition "Vanity", in Pompeii. I fell in love with the jewelry there. There was so much human touch visible in every piece! I tried to emulate this by casting the diamond directly into the metal, creating a rugged, molten look that I think works really well with the diamond slice.



What does a typical work day look like for you? As a solo show, I run all aspects of my brand. A typical day starts in the morning around 8am with a giant cup of coffee while I check emails. I usually like to make a to-do list the night before or at the start of a new week with the small details that I may easily overlook. Anything from quoting someone for a custom piece, to checking the price of gold that day, to making sure I ship out orders on time. I have yet to develop a good social media strategy, but this is my next goal. During this time, I also send out invoices and take note of any orders that have come in and need to be made.

Around 10-11am I put on my running clothes and take our dog, Olivia, for her morning run. This is also a good transition to my day, and builds up energy for the rest of it. After I get home and shower, I focus on the other half of running my business, working at the jeweler’s bench. All of my pieces are made by hand with some components being cast, therefore this part of my day is pretty time consuming, and at the same time really satisfying. Usually around 7 or 8 I stop, and if I’ve created anything new that needs to be added to my website, I set it aside to photograph in the morning. I've found the morning light to be great when taking pictures.

What has been the most important jewelry-making skill that you’ve learned and why?

It's hard to say as I see them all as being invaluable as each skill builds on the other. But, I think if I had to choose I would say soldering is invaluable to my work. Soldering is the process of fusing two pieces of metal together. I use it immensely when making my line of chains. Each link in the chain is formed, cut, and then fused together, one by one. It requires soldering for hours on end which can be tedious, but I love the process. It becomes a sort of meditation for me.

Your jewelry making style mentions the utilization of ancient techniques. Could you go into more detail on what some of those techniques are and why you're fond of using them? Yea, currently I’ve been intrigued by the style and techniques used in Byzantine and Etruscan jewelry. I love the boldness of the pieces that come from the Byzantine era, I find their use of pearls to be a great inspiration in my work. I'm also obsessed with the Filigree technique (use of finely twisted gold wires) from the Etruscan culture. I learned this technique while studying jewelry in Florence, and I’ve been using it ever since. It’s become a sort of trademark look in some of my designs.



The Grano Cuff is inspired by Etruscan granulation. The technique of adding small spheres of gold to a surface. I love the look of granulation and wanted to apply it in a more modern way by making an ear cuff out of it. The entire cuff is made by placing small granules next to and on top of one another.



I know sustainability is a very important part of Mon Pilar. Does that present any challenges in your work? The challenges I have come across so far involve sourcing colored gemstones and making my packaging sustainable. I have found a few sources that are ethical and more sustainable for buying gemstones but these come with a higher price point, so for now I mostly order them for custom pieces when a client wants a particular stone and is willing to invest in it. As for my packaging I am still in search of a company that makes beautiful packaging that is recycled and still affordable. I think there's always going to be challenges, but I'm fully invested in growing my brand ethically and responsibly.

I saw on your website that you do custom jewelry. What’s your favorite part about the collaborative process of making a custom piece?

Collaborating on a custom piece always comes with challenges, but I welcome them as they help me to grow and become a better designer. It's great when clients that know and like my work come to me with an idea. I then have the freedom and trust to do my best work while at the same time making their vision come to life.

If we ran into you on the street, what jewelry would you be wearing? (casual vs night out) I would have to say the Roma Necklace with the Orbis Hoops. These two have been my go to’s for a while now. I love the weight and look of the Roma. I love how unique it is, and that it looks great with a pair of jeans or a black dress. As for the hoops, they are sooo comfy! The charms are made from diamond slices with small diamonds embedded rustically into the metal to add some sparkle. They're removable so I sometimes wear the hoops solo for a more minimal look. Both pieces I wear day and night!

What do you hope the future looks like for Mon Pilar?


In the future I would love for Mon Pilar to be able to grow and to hire a few amazing people. I would like to hire someone to help with my social media and branding. This would give me more time to create and test out new designs. I would also eventually like to hire another goldsmith to work along side with.



To see more of Brigid's current collections, please visit her website at monpilar.com

title: HORT AND POTT
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
HORT AND POTT

  • Colleen Russell
  • Nov 15, 2023
  • 1 min read


Fueled by a lifelong passion for nature, craftsmanship, and beauty, Todd Carr and Carter Harrington established Hort and Pott in Upstate, NY in 2016. The charming botanical shop occupies a former boarding house from 1900, transformed into a haven for unique handmade goods for the home & garden. Carter's bespoke concrete pots and vases complement Todd's hand woven wreaths and garlands, crafted from foraged materials on their lush property.


What distinguishes Hort and Pott (short for horticulture and pottery), in the botanic industry is their wholehearted embrace of seasonal inspiration in every collection. Whether inspired by spring blossoms, the vibrant hues of summer, falls rich palette, or winter's serene greenery, their collections distill the essence of each season. The space showcases vintage finds alongside a diverse selection of locally crafted goods, whether handmade by Hort and Pott themselves or by other artisans near and far.


The release of their upcoming holiday collection prominently showcases Todd's handmade wreaths and garlands, accompanied by an array of both handmade and vintage ornaments, candle holders, and other decorative items, filling the shop with seasonal splendor and creativity.



Filled with warmth and whimsy, this enchanting shop nestled in Upstate, NY assures that there will be even more wonders to discover in the upcoming seasons.


Shop their collections online or visit in person, by appointment only, at Hort and Pott.

title: TIME BELL CANDLE HOLDER - NOUSAKU
author: Russell Nicolau
content:
TIME BELL CANDLE HOLDER - NOUSAKU

  • Colleen Russell
  • May 26, 2023
  • 1 min read


The aptly named Time Bell Candleholder from Nousaku is a mindful masterpiece embodying the essence of being present in the passing of time. This solid brass basin gracefully catches the falling brass pins as the candle burns, creating a soothing bell tone that beautifully signifies both the time that has passed and the present moment. Perfect for dinner parties or romantic evenings, it invites you to embrace the art of mindfulness and cherish each fleeting second.


Established in 1916, Nousaku, a respected Japanese brand, dedicated itself to the meticulous production of Buddhist ritual objects and Japanese tea sets. With their expertise in working with brass and bronze, they brought forth a range of refined creations, embodying the essence of Japanese craftsmanship. The artistry of each Nousaku creation begins with the intricate process of casting, utilizing a traditional technique that has been passed down through multiple generations for over 400 years in Takaoka, Japan.


From the careful crafting of a sand mold to the skilled finishing touches, these craftsmen bring out the inherent beauty and finesse of the materials. With precision and dedication, Nousaku transforms molten metal into timeless treasures, capturing the essence of art in every piece.


Available for purchase online at Jinen.
